intro: Loeselia cervantesii, commonly known as the Cervantes's loeselia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the family Loeseliaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival. Its botanical study contributes to the understanding of biodiversity in tropical ecosystems.
